details: Evaluates a wide range of health markers, including glucose, cholesterol, electrolytes, kidney and liver function.
Measures red blood cells, white blood cells, platelets, hemoglobin, and hematocrit to assess overall blood health.
Checks levels of thyroid hormones (TSH, T3, T4) to evaluate thyroid function, which affects metabolism and energy levels.
Measures cholesterol levels (total, HDL, LDL, triglycerides) to assess heart disease risk.
Tests blood sugar levels (fasting and A1C) to diagnose or monitor diabetes, a condition affecting blood sugar regulation.
Analyzes urine for abnormalities in composition, indicating possible kidney or urinary tract infections.
Records electrical activity of the heart to assess rhythm and detect abnormalities like arrhythmias.
Measures bone mineral density (BMD) in hips and spine, helping to assess osteoporosis risk and monitor treatment effectiveness. Early detection is crucial for preventing fractures.
